intro: Ponera, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of lance-shaped leaves and tall, branched flowering stalks. The flowers are typically small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels. Ponera species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and have historical uses in traditional medicine.
